title: mozilla deleted my history out of the blue
content: Hello, I have restarted my laptop only to find that my previous session was not retriavable anymore, so I went to my History and to my utter surprise it was gone. Years of history deleted. Could you help me understand what on Earth just happened?!?!?! Thanks in advance
creator: iapetus1

title: Firefox settings
content: I have been using Firefox as my default browser for decades now but I think I might have to change that very soon. I am unable to obtain sound when connected to the internet. I am hoping to start an online course to learn Python but when playing the first tutorial there was no sound at all. I looked for the problem via your website support page and discovered (for some obscure reason) that "Autoplay" is defaulted to "Block" in the Firefox settings. I decided to change this setting to "Allow audio and video" but to no avail. I've even tried listening to DIY store and Yuotube instructional videos but can't hear a thing. If I use MS Edge as my browser, the sound is fine. Am I missing something here? Is there more to changing the settings than I what I read? Anyway, I've enjoyed using Firefox over the years and really don't want to have to use a Microsoft browser. Is thete something you can suggest?
creator: dannynpauline36

title: App Update "disabled by my organization" but I'm not using an enterprise network. DisableAppUpdate is set to true for some reason (not by me)
content: Hi, I said most of it in the title. Somehow, my Firefox DisableAppUpdate policy got set to 'true' & when I try to change it Firefox says sorry "this is managed by your organization". But I'm not currently signed in to an enterprise network. This is on private wi-fi. Can you all fix this? I need to be able to manage policies like this *for my personal browser*, less is not okay. Thank you for your help.
creator: onymousalan

title: unsecure connection
content: I have a router set up at a remote site with a device that has a built in web server that allows viewing the items displayed. The router quit working so i replaced it with another one with the same configuration but now when I try to access through it The browser is complaining that it is unsecure and apparently resets the connection. I don't care if it is unsecure it is my site/router and I want to connect. I have used this configuration many times with no problems but firefox has done something to prevent it from working anymore, this started being a problem with some of these setups a couple years ago. How do I get it to connect anyway.
creator: howardbowen

title: Firefox no longer preserves cookies or site data between sessions
content:
For many years now I've had Firefox clear

  • browsing & download history
  • temporary cached files and pages
  • saved form info

but not

  • cookies and site date
  • site settings

This worked flawlessly until Firefox updated to version 136, at which point all cookies were deleted and I was signed out of every account on every website.

Looking at the settings page, the option to delete cookies and site data when Firefox is closed is now enabled. I don't remember what this setting used to look like, but I did not change it recently.

Unchecking the box seems to work, but I shouldn't suddenly have to do this, and the "damage" is done.

Why did the update to version 136 sign me out of every website, and how do I protect myself against this happening again?
creator: Jens_Lyn_IV
